perturbation.original_text: 1.1 The "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB" has the meaning given to such term in the Distribution Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 The "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB" refers to any activity involving the temporary provision of tools or machinery, regardless of its classification in the Distribution Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of "Equipment Rental Business" to be independent of the Distribution Agreement, the contract introduces ambiguity and conflicts with the original intent of aligning the definition with the Distribution Agreement. This creates uncertainty about which activities are governed by the intellectual property agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 1.2 "Interim Period" means a period of four (4) years commencing from the Effective Date of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 "Interim Period" means a period determined by the mutual agreement of THC and HERC, starting approximately from the Effective Date of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces ambiguity by replacing the fixed four-year term with a period determined by mutual agreement. This contradicts the original, clear definition and creates uncertainty about the duration of the agreement and the associated intellectual property rights.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2 Indemnification of HERC related to use of HERTZ trademark during the Interim Period. HSI shall defend, indemnify and hold HERC harmless against any and all claims, suits, actions or other proceedings whatsoever brought against HERC based on third-party claims of trademark infringement in connection with HERC'S use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks, the HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks and the Other Intellectual Property to the extent such claims, suits, actions or other proceedings are based upon use of the HERTZ element comprising a HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademark, HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademark, HERC (HERTZ) US ERB Trademark or Other Intellectual Property during the Interim Period only and from claims of third parties against HERC or any of its affiliates stemming from HERTZ's use of the HERTZ trademarks.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2 Indemnification of HERC related to use of HERTZ trademark. HSI may, at its sole discretion, defend, indemnify and hold HERC harmless against claims brought against HERC based on third-party claims of trademark infringement. This indemnification applies only to claims HSI deems valid.
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes the mandatory indemnification obligation of HSI to a discretionary one. By introducing "may, at its sole discretion", the contract contradicts the original intent of providing clear indemnification. Also, by limiting to claims that HSI deems valid opens to legal ambiguity that might make the original statement unenforceable.
